 Expanded/Free Access during COVID-19 Closure: Journals

 Journals 
 
 
 
 
 Video and Music 
 
   
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Journal access facts
                                 
 
 
 
 
 Even pre-COVID, the vast majority of our journal access was online.  
 The best way to find articles is typically through a  database .  
 Clicking on  UC-eLinks  from an  article database  is still a great way to try to get access to individual articles. 
 If that doesn't work, feel free to submit an ILL (right from the UC-eLinks form). 
 Additional, temporary, access has been provided by some journal publishers and vendors to address campus closures. 
 If you want to try to track down access to journals we don't typically own on your own, you can go directly to the publisher websites or search through  Google Scholar  (click on the article title rather than UC-eLinks). 
 Publishers and vendors we know to be offering additional access will be listed on this guide. 
 
 
 
 Databases By Subject 
 Access articles in full-text from this listing of UCR Library databases by subject. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 JSTOR
                                 
 
 
 
 
 JSTOR   Because we already license content through JSTOR, they are making the rest of their journal content available to UCR users through June 2021. 
 
Enable VPN to access 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Ask a Librarian
                                 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 How to Connect from off Campus
                                 
 
 
 
 Before you begin your research, connect to the Library. 
 
 Install the  GlobalProtect VPN 
 URL: campusvpn.ucr.edu  
 Sign in: NetID and Password 
 Verify: Using  Multi-factor Authentication (MFA)   
 Use: Open any browser and access library resources 
 Pin GlobalProtect somewhere easy to access 
 
 
 
 Connecting from Off Campus 
 Our LibGuide for in-depth instructions on remote access
